title: Cantele 2015 Primitivo (Salento)
description: Baked berry and sweet spice aromas dominate the nose, while toasted oak tones arise on the palate. Medium in weight and light in concentration, crisp acidity keeps this refreshing, but short.

title: Casa L'Angel 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Valencia)
description: A dark purple color and aromas of blackberry, creamy oak and pencil lead to a raw, pulling palate that's thick but also high in tartaric acidity. Grainy oak and mocha flavors make a louder statement than does the fruit.

title: Duca di Saragnano 2014  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: Aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit, violet and a whiff of wet leather lead the nose. The palate starts off with fleshy black cherry and a hint of clove then but quickly falls apart thanks to loose, fleeting tannins.

title: Fattoria di Magliano 2016 Illario Rosato (Maremma Toscana)
description: Made entirely with organically farmed Sangiovese, this has delicate aromas suggesting wild berry and blue flower. The fresh, simple palate offers hints of Marasca cherry and raspberry alongside bright acidity.

title: Fetzer 2016 Sundial Chardonnay (California)
description: Pale lemon and thyme aromas precede a very buttery flavor in this split-personality wine. It is medium bodied, crisp at first sip but turns butterscotchy on the palate.

title: La Val 2012 Fermentado en Barrica Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Flowery, yeasty aromas are also soapy and buttery, which makes sense given that this is overly mature and was brought up in oak barrels. Moderate acidity means balance is fleeting, and the wine tastes of stale stone fruits and yeast.

title: Methven Family Vineyards 2014 House Block Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Despite the landmark vintage, this wine seems thin, under-ripe, and rife with green stem and herb flavors. The tannins are substantial, hard and bitter, effectively blocking out the finish.

title: Minimus 2016 #23 Noir Red (Willamette Valley)
description: The Noir is an equal blend of co-fermented Gamay Noir, Pinot Noir and Trousseau Noir. An interesting experiment, but it emerges with a bitterness around barely ripe flavors of rhubarb and pink berry.

title: Monterebro 2016 Barrica Red (Jumilla)
description: Raw, herbal, oaky aromas include notes of Navajo sage stick and oak-driven clove. This wine is 85% Monastrell with Syrah, and it feels grabby, tannic and oaky. Creamy oak flavors are soupy, while this wine is plump, chewy and tastes of forced oak on the finish.

title: Oak Knoll NV Toasted Cow Vintners Blend 6th Edition Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is half Syrah with the rest equal parts Pinot Noir and Tempranillo. Aromas are locked up on first pour, only revealing high-toned notes of barrel spice. Over time, notes of candied raspberry, black licorice and dried cherry start to emerge. The palate brings plump red- and black-fruit flavors. Cranberry notes linger on the finish.

title: Parras Wines 2015 Desafinado Unoaked Red (Douro)
description: This wine, with its light structure and ripe red-berry flavors, is all fruit. It has stalky tannins and plenty of acidity and crispness. It's light, fruity and ready to drink.

title: Poema NV Extra Dry Sparkling (Cava)
description: Cidery apple aromas are yeasty and powdery. This is regular in feel, without much body or depth. Basic flavors of lemon-lime and apple juice are sugary, while this showslightly oxidized flavors on the finish.

title: Seacampo 2016 Quinta do Vale Branco White (Dão)
description: A fruity blend of Cerceal, Bical and Encruzado, this easy, fruity wine is tangy, full of citrus and orange zest and refreshing. Acidity and crisp flavors are balanced by ripe yellow fruits and an attractive perfumed edge. Drink now.

title: Vecchia Cantina di Montepulciano 2013 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Funky aromas of moist underbrush, tilled soil, new leather and game carry over to the rather muddled palate along with black cherry extract, a green note of powdered sage and a hint of clove. Dusty fleeting tannins leave a drying grainy finish.

title: Fritz Windisch 2016 Heimersheimer Rotenfels Dornfelder (Rheinhessen)
description: This soft, semisweet Dornfelder is a candied swirl of cherry-cola, vanilla and chocolate flavors. It's a plush, easy wine for early consumption.

title: La Montina NV Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: Toast, cured meat and roasted herb aromas come to the forefront. On the vivacious palate, dried sage and toasted walnut underscore yellow apple while lively acidity and vigorous bubbles provide the aggressive setting.

title: Lo Sparviere NV Extra Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: This opens with aromas suggesting medicinal herb, adhesive bandage and dried bread crust. The rather pungent aromas follow over to the lean palate together with bitter walnut skin and a hint of acacia honey.

title: SIP 2015 Moscato (California)
description: This dessert-style wine is quite flavorful and sweet, from the aroma of apple cider and toasted nuts to flavors of golden raisins and honey. It has an almost thick texture and syrupy finish.

title: Three of Cups 2016 White (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is a blend of Sauvignon Blanc (61%), Sémillon (23%), Riesling (12%) and Albariño. The aromas are a bit faint, with notes of herb, fig, pear and soda water that don't seem entirely in sync. The palate brings broad, dry flavors that come up short.

title: Vicente Faria Vinhos 2016 Animus Red (Douro)
description: This wine has soft tannins and juicy red fruits. It is ripe, with a gentle texture, bright fruitiness and enough tannins to give the fruit their support. Drink this attractive wine now.

title: Watermill 2014 Estate Vineyard Tempranillo
description: The aromas are oak dominated, with notes of vanilla extract, coconut, dill, spearmint and freshly hewn wood, with the fruit struggling to get to the surface. There's a soft, pleasing feel to the palate but the wood again gets in the way. The fruit is hard to find.

title: Whitetail Ridge 2016 Viognier (Umpqua Valley)
description: Viognier can turn sharp and bitter, as it hints at here. The flavors emphasize green botanicals, lime skin and pith. It's definitely on the less-than-optimal side of ripe for this difficult grape.

title: Cantine del Borgo Reale 2015 Pinot Nero (Puglia)
description: An outlier grape for southern Italy, this Pinot Nero is primary in its ripe cherry and raspberry flavors. It's light, bright and juicy nature make it an easy-drinking selection.

title: Borgo La Cacia 2015  Lugana
description: Lightly scented, this has subdued whiffs of ripe yellow stone fruit. The simple palate, offers ripe yellow pear and nectarine zest.

title: Chankaska 2015 Marquette (Minnesota)
description: Aromas of cranberry, cherry pie and baking spice are inviting on the nose. The palate brings more cranberry and cherry, joined by ripe, juicy pomegranate. Gentle tannins slowly emerge while the tart acidity lightens the baked quality of the fruit flavors. Tart fruit tones linger on the finish, with clove and a final grip of tannin.

title: Château Bessan Ségur 2015  Médoc
description: This is a heavily wooded wine, more spice and toast than fruit. Hints of the half-and-half blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon show behind all this woodiness and hopefully will get a chance in the future.

title: Château la Chandellière 2015  Médoc
description: This smoky wine has firm tannins and an intense core of dryness. It seems tough and perhaps without enough fruit. The future will see the tannins soften in this Cabernet Sauvignon dominant wine, but it's a question whether the fruit will be sufficient to balance the tannins.

title: Concura 2016 Fasi Primitivo (Puglia)
description: Dark, jammy fruit aromas are at the core of this otherwise oak-driven wine. Baking spice flavors of vanilla and cocoa powder are prominent and not entirely integrated with the baked fruit character. Medium weight and soft acidity make this an easy-drinking sipper.

title: Layer Cake 2015 Primitivo (Puglia)
description: There's a great deal of oak covering the red berry aromas on the nose. The medium-bodied palate shows a bit more integration, melding dark cherry and blackberry flavors with baking spice.

title: Leone de Castris 2016 Maiana Negroamaro (Salice Salentino)
description: Ripe red berry and plum aromas are covered in a sheen of vanilla and cocoa in this Negroamaro-dominant wine. Medium in weight, with a soft feel, enjoy this with hard cheeses.
